page.title: 11Hillfarrance Church
page.content: Hillfarrance is listed in the original Domesday Survey as Hilla. Later the name of the Ferun family was added and Hulle-Ferun eventually became Hillfarrance. The Church of the Holy Cross occupies a central position by the village green. It is a small, simple, building, at least seven hundred years old, which consists of a nave, chancel, porch, chapel on the south side and a tower at the west end. The tower was built following a bequest made by a certain John Peryn of Wellington in his will dated 1509. It houses a peal of six bells which are still rung. Although the interior appears plain, with only clear glass windows, it has an elaborately carved pew ends, each with an original and different design.
